static.declarationSignature: public static com.layer.sdk.LayerClient newInstance(android.content.Context context, java.util.UUID layerAppId, java.lang.String gcmSenderId)
static.name: newInstance
static.comment:
Generates a new LayerClient, ready for authentication and sending messages.  Supply a GCM
sender ID if you would like the LayerClient to handle GCM registration for you.  Otherwise,
supply `null` and use setGcmRegistrationId(senderId, registrationId).  The latter is useful
if you would like your app to receive GCM from multiple senders.

returns.description: a new LayerClient, ready to authenticate.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context in which to create this client.

parameters.name: layerAppId
parameters.description: Layer-provided `App ID`, from the Layer Console.

parameters.name: gcmSenderId
parameters.description: Google Cloud Messaging `Sender ID` for receiving GCM pushes.

static.declarationSignature: public static com.layer.sdk.LayerClient newInstance(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String layerAppId)
static.name: newInstance
static.comment: Generates a new LayerClient, ready for authentication and sending messages.

returns.description: a new LayerClient, ready to authenticate.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context in which to create this client.

static.declarationSignature: public static com.layer.sdk.LayerClient newInstance(android.content.Context context, java.lang.String layerAppId, com.layer.sdk.LayerClient.Options options)
static.name: newInstance
static.comment: Generates a new LayerClient, ready for authentication and sending messages.

returns.description: a new LayerClient, ready to authenticate.

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context in which to create this client.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Set of options for LayerClient (use new Options().googleCloudMessagingSenderId(String))

static.name: enableLogging
static.comment:
Layer sdk logs to logcat using the tag 'LayerSDK'.

The log levels can be set using one of the following ways.
1. set system property : setprop log.tag.LayerSDK [Log Level]
2. Create a local.prop file with the following in it: 'log.tag.LayerSDK= [Log Level]' and
   place that in /data/local.prop.
Possible values for '[Log Level]' are VERBOSE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, ASSERT or SUPPRESS.

Eg: To enable verbose logging, use 'adb shell setprop log.tag.LayerSDK VERBOSE'

For details, refer to
http://developer.android.com/reference/android/util/Log.html#isLoggable(java.lang.String, int)

static.declarationSignature: public static void sendLogs(com.layer.sdk.LayerClient client, android.app.Activity from)
static.name: sendLogs
static.comment: Creates an email with logs and other relevant information

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: : LayerClient object when available. Can be set to null

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
: The activity to use as context for sending out the email containing logs

NOTE: The logs might include personally identifiable information. Please refer to
Layer's privacy policy [ https://layer.com/privacy ] to understand how Layer handles PII.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract com.layer.sdk.messaging.Conversation newConversation(com.layer.sdk.messaging.ConversationOptions options, java.util.List participants)
instance.name: newConversation
instance.comment: Constructs a new Conversation with the provided participants.

returns.description: a Conversation ready for messages.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: List of participants to include in this Conversation.

instance.name: getConversationIds
instance.comment:
Returns a list of all Conversation IDs.  Conversation objects can then be loaded by ID with
either the getConversation(id) or getConversations(ids) methods.  Such a combination can be
used to implement a lazy loading mechanism, such as an Adapter for a Conversation ListView.
The Adapter can be made dynamic by implementing a LayerChangeEventListener interface.

returns.description: a list of all Conversation IDs.

instance.name: getConversation
instance.comment: Returns the existing Conversation with the given ID, or `null`.

returns.description: the Conversation with the provided ID, or `null` if no such Conversation exists.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the unique identifier for the Conversation to return.

instance.name: getConversations
instance.comment: Returns a list of Conversations with the given IDs.

returns.description: a list of Conversations with the provided IDs, or an empty list if none are found.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: the unique identifiers for the Conversations to return.

instance.name: getConversations
instance.comment:
Returns all stored Conversations.  To preserve memory and enable a more responsive user
experience, consider using a combination of getConversationIds() and one of the get-by-ID
methods instead.

returns.description: a list of all Conversations.

instance.name: getConversationsWithParticipants
instance.comment: Returns a list of Conversations containing the exact set of participants (and no more).

returns.description:
a list of Conversations containing the provided participants, or an empty list if
none are found.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: the list of participants to find Conversations for.

instance.name: newMessage
instance.comment: Constructs a new Message with the given list of MessageParts.

returns.description: A new Message ready to send.

parameters.name: messageParts
parameters.description: A list of MessageParts to send with this Message.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: A MIME type identifying the type of data contained in the given data object.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: The data to be embedded in the MessagePart.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract com.layer.sdk.messaging.MessagePart newMessagePart(java.lang.String mimeType, java.io.InputStream stream, long length)
instance.name: newMessagePart
instance.comment:
Creates a MessagePart with the given MIME type and data with size `length` from the given
InputStream.

parameters.name: mimeType
parameters.description: A MIME type identifying the type of data contained in the given data object.

parameters.name: stream
parameters.description: InputStream to read data from.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Bytes of data to read from the InputStream.

instance.name: newMessagePart
instance.comment:
Creates a MessagePart with a string of text, encoded into a byte array in UTF-8 format.

This is a convenience accessor encapsulating the common operation of creating a message part
with a plain text data attachment in UTF-8 encoding. It is functionally equivalent to the
following example code:

MessagePart("text/plain", text.getBytes("UTF-8"));

returns.description:
A new message part with the MIME Type text/plain and a UTF-8 encoded representation
of the given input text.

parameters.name: plainText
parameters.description: The plain text body of the new message part.

instance.name: getMessageIds
instance.comment:
Returns an ordered list of IDs for Messages within a given Conversation.  Message objects can
then be loaded by ID with either the getMessage(id) or getMessages(ids) methods.  This
implements a lazy loading mechanism, useful in applications like an Adapter for a ListView of
a Conversation's Messages.  The Adapter can be made dynamic by implementing a
LayerChangeEventListener interface and handling INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE events.  The
returned list's order attempts to preserve a natural conversational ordering of Messages,
allowing this list to directly drive a Conversation's list of Messages in typical chat
applications.  Ordering is generated using a sequence-based algorithm rather than timestamps.

returns.description: the list of Message IDs within a Conversation, in conversational order.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: the Conversation for which to retrieve Message IDs.

instance.name: getMessage
instance.comment: Returns a Message with the given ID, or `null` if no such Message is found.

returns.description: the Message with the given ID, or `null` if no such Message is found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: the unique ID of the Message to return.

instance.name: getMessages
instance.comment: Returns a list of Messages with the given IDs, or an empty list of none are found.

returns.description: a list of Messages with the given IDs, or an empty list of none are found.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: the unique IDs of the Messages to return, or an empty list if none are found.

instance.name: getMessages
instance.comment:
Returns an ordered list of Messages within a given Conversation, in conversational order.
To preserve memory and enable a more responsive user experience, consider using a combination
of getMessageIds() and one of the get-by-ID methods instead.

returns.description: an ordered list of all Messages in the given Conversation.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: the Conversation for which to retrieve Message IDs.

instance.name: get
instance.comment: Loads a Queryable object (Conversation or Message) by ID.

returns.description: The Queryable object, or null if no object could be found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Queryable object ID.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract java.util.List executeQuery(com.layer.sdk.query.Query query, com.layer.sdk.query.Query.ResultType resultType)
instance.name: executeQuery
instance.comment:
Executes the given Query for the given ResultType.  Results must be cast to their respective
types; IDs to a list of Uris, Objects to a list of Messages or Conversations, and Count to a
list of Longs.  For type-safe queries, use executeQueryForIds, executeQueryForObjects, or
executeQueryForCount.

returns.description: The results of executing the provided Query for the provided ResultType.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute.

parameters.name: resultType
parameters.description: Type of results to return.

instance.name: executeQueryForIds
instance.comment:
Executes the given Query, returning a list of object IDs.  Use get(id) to lazily load the
identified object.

returns.description: List of object IDs returned from executing the Query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute.

instance.name: executeQueryForObjects
instance.comment: Executes the given Query, returning a list of objects (Conversations or Messages).

returns.description: List of objects returned from executing the Query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query to execute.

instance.name: executeQueryForCount
instance.comment:
Example for count of unread messages across all conversations:
LayerClient.executeQueryForCount(Query.builder(Message.class)
.predicate(new Predicate(Message.Property.IS_UNREAD, Predicate.Operator.EQUAL_TO, true))
.build());

Example for count of unread messages for a given conversation:
LayerClient.executeQueryForCount(Query.builder(Message.class)
.predicate(new CompoundPredicate(CompoundPredicate.Type.AND,
new Predicate(Message.Property.IS_UNREAD, Predicate.Operator.EQUAL_TO, true),
new Predicate(Message.Property.CONVERSATION, Predicate.Operator.EQUAL_TO, conversation)))
.build())

Example for count of conversations with unread messages:
LayerClient.executeQueryForCount(Query.builder(Conversation.class)
.predicate(new Predicate(Conversation.Property.HAS_UNREAD_MESSAGES, Predicate.Operator.EQUAL_TO, true))
.build())

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract com.layer.sdk.query.RecyclerViewController newRecyclerViewController(com.layer.sdk.query.Query query, java.util.Collection updateableProperties, com.layer.sdk.internal.query.QueryController.Callback callback)
instance.name: newRecyclerViewController
instance.comment:
Returns a new RecyclerViewController instance.  RecyclerViewController is used to drive a
RecyclerView.Adapter from a Query.  This controller automatically generates callbacks for
notifying UI updates.

returns.description: RecyclerViewController ready for notifying a RecyclerView.Adapter.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The Query to execute for elements and updates.

parameters.name: updateableProperties
parameters.description:
An optional set of properties to listen for.  If null, all
                            property updates are considered for UI content updates.  If not
                            null, then only content updates matching a provided property are
                            notified as content updates.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback to notify structural and content updates.

instance.name: registerEventListener
instance.comment:
Registers a LayerChangeEventListener for observing change events.  Change events are emitted
for insertion, update, and deletion of Conversation and Message objects.  This allows a
listener to dynamically synchronize UI elements in the main thread or an external search
index in a background thread, for example.  Each emitted event contains a reference to the
target object.  Updates also contain the updated attribute, along with its old and new value.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerChangeEventListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterEventListener
instance.comment: Stops a LayerChangeEventListener from listening for change events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerChangeEventListener to unregister.

returns.description: the ID for the current authenticated user, or `null` if not authenticated with Layer.

instance.name: isAuthenticated
instance.comment: Returns `true` if the LayerClient has an authenticated session.

returns.description: `true` if the LayerClient has an authenticated session.

instance.name: authenticate
instance.comment:
Tells the client to begin authenticating with current credentials, if they exist.  If no
credentials exist, or the credentials are no longer valid, Layer will respond with a `nonce`
challenge provided to the LayerAuthenticationListener.onAuthenticationChallenge() listener
method. Respond to the challenge with LayerClient.answerAuthenticationChallenge(), providing
your externally-generated `identity token` (see the getting started guide).  You must have
connected with a call to connect() prior to authenticating.

instance.name: deauthenticate
instance.comment:
Tells the client to drop all credentials and deauthenticate its session.  On success, also
clears any local data synchronized with Layer.

instance.name: answerAuthenticationChallenge
instance.comment:
Responds to a challenge from LayerAuthenticationListener.onAuthenticationChallenge().
Challenges may come at other times besides the authentication process initialized by a call
to `authenticate()`.  You must be ready to generate `identity tokens` in the background -
via an authenticated session with your backend or similar - to maintain an uninterrupted user
experience.

instance.name: registerAuthenticationListener
instance.comment:
Registers a LayerAuthenticationListener for observing authentication callbacks.
Authentication callbacks allow a listener to monitor authentication state and to respond to
authentication challenges.  This listener is required to complete authentication: the `nonce`
provided in onAuthenticationChallenge() must be used to generate the challenge's response, in
the form of an `identity token` provided to the LayerClient.answerAuthenticationChallenge()
method.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerAuthenticationListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterAuthenticationListener
instance.comment: Stops a LayerAuthenticationListener from observing authentication events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerAuthenticationListener to unregister.

instance.name: connect
instance.comment:
Tells the client to connect to Layer, resuming a prior session, if it exists.  A prior
session exists if a call to getAuthenticatedUserId() returns a non-null value.  If no session
exists, or the session is no longer valid, the caller must start the authentication process
with a call to authenticate().

instance.name: disconnect
instance.comment: Tells the client to disconnect all network connections with Layer.

instance.name: registerConnectionListener
instance.comment:
Registers a LayerConnectionListener for observing connection callbacks.  Connection callbacks
allow a listener to monitor connection state with the Layer Cloud.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerConnectionListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterConnectionListener
instance.comment: Stops a LayerConnectionListener from observing connection events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerConnectionListener to unregister.

instance.name: isConnected
instance.comment:
Returns `true` if this LayerClient has a connection to Layer services.  The authentication
state can be separately determined with getAuthenticatedUserId().

returns.description: `true` if this LayerClient has a connection to Layer services.

instance.name: isConnecting
instance.comment: Returns `true` if this LayerClient is attempting to establish a connection to Layer services.

returns.description: `true` if this LayerClient is attempting to establish a connection to Layer services.

instance.name: registerSyncListener
instance.comment:
Registers a LayerSyncListener for observing sync callbacks.  Sync callbacks let a listener
monitor the onset and completion of synchronization with the Layer Cloud.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerSyncListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterSyncListener
instance.comment: Stops a LayerSyncListener from observing sync events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerSyncListener to unregister.

instance.name: setAutoDownloadSizeThreshold
instance.comment:
Set the maximum size for which content will be autodownloaded. Larger content
will remain pending until until a download is triggered by
{@link com.layer.sdk.messaging.MessagePart#download(com.layer.sdk.listeners.LayerProgressListener)}.
This defaults to 2KB, and lower values are now allowed.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: bytes
parameters.description: the maximum size of content to be autodownloaded

instance.name: setAutoDownloadMimeTypes
instance.comment:
Set the MIME types for which content will be autodownloaded, regardless of the size threshold set by
{@link com.layer.sdk.LayerClient#setAutoDownloadSizeThreshold(long)}. Other content
will remain pending until a download is triggered by
{@link com.layer.sdk.messaging.MessagePart#download(com.layer.sdk.listeners.LayerProgressListener)}.
This defaults to a list containing only "text/plain".  Setting to null will download everything.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: mimeTypes
parameters.description: the MIME types to autodownload

instance.name: setDiskCapacity
instance.comment:
Set the maximum amount of disk space to be used storing message data.
A value of zero (the default) means no limit. Utilization may periodically
peak above the configured `diskCapacity` while synchronization or downloads
are in progress, but will be rebalanced once all operations have completed.

parameters.name: bytes
parameters.description: Maximum amount of space to use

instance.name: getDiskUtilization
instance.comment: Return the current amount of disk space being used on message data

returns.description: the current usage

instance.name: registerTypingIndicator
instance.comment: Registers a LayerTypingIndicatorListener for observing typing indication callbacks.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerTypingIndicatorListener to register.

instance.name: unregisterTypingIndicator
instance.comment: Stops a LayerTypingIndicatorListener from observing typing indication events.

returns.description: this LayerClient.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: the LayerTypingIndicatorListener to unregister.

instance.comment: Returns this client's Layer `App ID`.

returns.description: the Layer `App ID`.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract void setGcmRegistrationId(java.lang.String senderId, java.lang.String registrationId)
instance.name: setGcmRegistrationId
instance.comment:
If your app registers for GCM itself (e.g. because it accepts GCM from multiple senders), you
should pass the LayerClient constructor `null` for the GCM sender ID field, and register GCM
externally with a comma-separated list of sender IDs as recommended here:
- http://developer.android.com/google/gcm/adv.html#multi-senders
After obtaining a registration ID, supply the registration ID to the LayerClient with this
method.

parameters.name: registrationId
parameters.description: The GCM registration ID returned by the GCM registration service.

returns.description: The List of `Policy` objects governing the behavior of the client.

Validates the given policy to determine if it represents a valid configuration that can be

returns.description: true if the given policy is valid, or false if not.

returns.description: true if the `Policy` was added.

instance.comment: Returns the list of Changes represented by this LayerChangeEvent.

classes.name: LayerChangeEvent
classes.comment:
A LayerChangeEvent represents a list of Changes during foreground public API usage or background
synchronization.  These Changes can be used to synchronize UI state or an index within external
storage with dynamic Layer Conversation and Message object mutations.

constructor.declarationSignature: public LayerChange(com.layer.sdk.changes.LayerChange.Type changeType, com.layer.sdk.messaging.LayerObject object, java.lang.String attributeName, java.lang.Object oldValue, java.lang.Object newValue)
constructor.name: LayerChange

instance.name: getObjectType
instance.comment: Returns the LayerObject.Type associated with this event.

returns.description: The LayerObject.Type associated with this event.

instance.name: getChangeType
instance.comment: Returns the LayerChange.Type associated with this event.

returns.description: The LayerChange.Type associated with this event.

instance.name: getObject
instance.comment: Returns the object associated with this event (Message or Conversation).

returns.description: The object associated with this event (Message or Conversation).

instance.name: getAttributeName
instance.comment:
Returns the name of the updated attribute.  Only valid for Type.UPDATE.
Attribute names depend on the Type of the LayerObject:
CONVERSATION
"id"
"isDeleted"
"lastMessage"
"metadata"
"participants"

MESSAGE
"id"
"isSent" 
"isDeleted"
"position"
"receivedAt"
"sentAt"
"recipientStatus"

MESSAGE_PART
"id"
"transferStatus"
"isPruned"

returns.description: The name of the updated attribute.

instance.name: getOldValue
instance.comment: Returns the previous value of the changed attribute.  Only valid for Type.UPDATE.

returns.description: The previous value of the changed attribute.

instance.name: getNewValue
instance.comment: Returns the new value of the changed attribute.  Only valid for Type.UPDATE.

returns.description: The new value of the changed attribute.

classes.name: LayerChange
classes.comment:
Changes represent INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE actions applied to Layer Conversation and Message
objects.  INSERT and DELETE types contain a cached object reference to the object that was either
added or removed from the Layer persistence.  UPDATE types contain the cached object reference
along with a String representation of the attribute that changed, the attribute's old value,
and the attribute's new value.

instance.name: onProgressError

classes.name: LayerProgressListener
classes.comment: Tracks the progress of a MessagePart download

classes.name: LayerChangeEventListener
classes.comment:
LayerChangeEventListeners attach to a LayerClient and receive events when Layer objects change.
For example, a Conversation may get inserted, or a Message may get sent or read, or a MessagePart
may complete uploading/downloading.  Listeners must implement one of the sub-interfaces:
- BackgroundThread: receives LayerChangeEvents on a different thread than the main UI thread.
- MainThread: receives LayerChangeEvents on the main UI thread.

implementedInterfaces.name: LayerChangeEventListener
implementedInterfaces.comment:
LayerChangeEventListeners attach to a LayerClient and receive events when Layer objects change.
For example, a Conversation may get inserted, or a Message may get sent or read, or a MessagePart
may complete uploading/downloading.  Listeners must implement one of the sub-interfaces:
- BackgroundThread: receives LayerChangeEvents on a different thread than the main UI thread.
- MainThread: receives LayerChangeEvents on the main UI thread.

nestedClasses.name: BackgroundThread
nestedClasses.comment: LayerChangeEventListener.BackgroundThread receives LayerChangeEvents on a background thread.

implementedInterfaces.name: LayerChangeEventListener
implementedInterfaces.comment:
LayerChangeEventListeners attach to a LayerClient and receive events when Layer objects change.
For example, a Conversation may get inserted, or a Message may get sent or read, or a MessagePart
may complete uploading/downloading.  Listeners must implement one of the sub-interfaces:
- BackgroundThread: receives LayerChangeEvents on a different thread than the main UI thread.
- MainThread: receives LayerChangeEvents on the main UI thread.

nestedClasses.name: MainThread
nestedClasses.comment: LayerChangeEventListener.MainThread receives LayerChangeEvents on the main UI thread.

derivedClasses.name: BackgroundThread
derivedClasses.comment: LayerChangeEventListener.BackgroundThread receives LayerChangeEvents on a background thread.

derivedClasses.name: MainThread
derivedClasses.comment: LayerChangeEventListener.MainThread receives LayerChangeEvents on the main UI thread.

instance.name: onTypingIndicator
instance.comment: Called when a remote typing indicator is received.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The LayerClient that received the typing indicator.

parameters.name: conversation
parameters.description: The Conversation the typing indicator was received for.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID who generated the typing indicator.

parameters.name: typingIndicator
parameters.description: The TypingIndicator event.

classes.name: LayerTypingIndicatorListener
classes.comment:
LayerTypingIndicatorListener provides listeners with callbacks when a remote typing indication is
received.

enumClasses.name: TypingIndicator
enumClasses.comment: Enumeration representing a typing indication event.

instance.declarationSignature: public void onAuthenticated(com.layer.sdk.LayerClient client, java.lang.String userId)
instance.name: onAuthenticated

instance.declarationSignature: public void onPolicyListUpdate(com.layer.sdk.LayerClient client, java.util.List oldPolicyList, java.util.List newPolicyList)
instance.name: onPolicyListUpdate
instance.comment: Alerts a listener to policy updates.

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The LayerClient reporting this policy update.

parameters.name: oldPolicyList
parameters.description: The list of policies prior to this update.

parameters.name: newPolicyList
parameters.description: The list of policies after this update.

classes.name: LayerPolicyListener
classes.comment: LayerPolicyListener allows an external class to monitor a LayerClient for policy updates.

derivedClasses.name: MessagePart
derivedClasses.comment:
The `MessagePart` class represents a piece of content embedded within a containing
Message. Each part has a specific MIME type identifying the type of content it contains.
Messages may contain an arbitrary number of parts with any MIME type that the application
wishes to support.

derivedClasses.name: Message
derivedClasses.comment:
The `Message` class represents a message within a conversation (modeled by the `Conversation`
class) between two or more participants within Layer.

derivedClasses.name: Conversation
derivedClasses.comment:
The `Conversation` class models a conversations between two or more participants within Layer. A
conversation is an on-going stream of messages (modeled by the `Message` class) synchronized
among all participants.

implementedInterfaces.name: Queryable
implementedInterfaces.comment:
Objects with Query support declare so on a per attribute basis by implementing this `Queryable`
interface.  Not all operators are available for each `Queryable` attribute. Consult the
documentation on each property for details about querying semantics.

instance.name: delete
instance.comment:
Deletes a Message according to the DeletionMode provided.  Any in-memory representations of
the Message will now return `true` on Message.isDeleted().

Message deletion can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and listening for
Message DELETE events.

parameters.name: deletionMode
parameters.description: the deletion mode to apply.

instance.name: markAsRead
instance.comment:
Marks a Message as `read` and synchronizes the "read receipt" among all participants in the
Conversation, as well as all other devices the authenticated user logs in on.

Recipient status can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on the "recipientStatus" attribute.

instance.name: getId
instance.comment: A unique identifier for this Message.

returns.description: a unique identifier for this Message.

instance.name: getPosition
instance.comment:
Returns the conversational order of this Message within its Conversation.  Prior to sending,
the return value will be equal to Long.MAX_VALUE.

returns.description: the conversational order of this message, starting from 0 with the oldest message.

instance.name: getConversation
instance.comment: Returns the Conversation that the Message is a part of.

returns.description: the Conversation that the Message is a part of.

instance.name: getMessageParts
instance.comment:
Returns a list of message parts (modeled by the `MessagePart` class) that provide access to
the content of Message.

returns.description: this Message's list of MessageParts.

instance.name: isSent
instance.comment:
A message is considered `sent` after synchronization with the Layer Cloud..

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture the `isSent` transition by listening for deletes.

returns.description: `true` if this message has been deleted locally or remotely with deleteMessage().

instance.name: isDeleted
instance.comment:
A message is considered `deleted` after LayerClient.deleteMessage() has been called on it.

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture the `deleted` transition by listening for deletes.

returns.description: `true` if this message has been deleted locally or remotely with deleteMessage().

instance.name: getSentAt
instance.comment: The date and time that the message was originally sent.

returns.description: the date and time that the message was originally sent.

instance.name: getReceivedAt
instance.comment:
The date and time that the message was received by the authenticated user, or `null` if they
are the sender.

returns.description:
the date and time that the message was received by the authenticated user, or `null`
if they are the sender.

instance.name: getSentByUserId
instance.comment: Returns the user ID of the user who sent the message.

returns.description: the user ID of the user who sent the message.

instance.name: getRecipientStatus
instance.comment:
Returns a dictionary keyed by the user ID of all participants in the conversation that the
message is a part of, and whose values are `RecipientStatus` representations of each
recipient's status.

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture recipient status transitions by listening for updates
on the "receipt" attribute.

instance.name: getRecipientStatus
instance.comment:
Retrieves the message state for a given participant in the conversation.

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture recipient status transitions by listening for updates
on the "receipt" attribute.

returns.description:
A `MessageState` value specifying the message state for the given participant or
`null` if the specified user is not a participant in the conversation.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user ID to retrieve the message state for.

classes.name: Message
classes.comment:
The `Message` class represents a message within a conversation (modeled by the `Conversation`
class) between two or more participants within Layer.

enumClasses.name: RecipientStatus
enumClasses.comment: `RecipientStatus` is an enumerated value declaring the lifecycle states for recipient status.

instance.name: isSortable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is sortable or not

returns.description: true when the Property is sortable, false otherwise

instance.name: isEqualityQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by equality or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by equality or not

instance.name: isRelativeQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by relation or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by relation or not

instance.name: isInclusionQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by inclusion or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by inclusion or not

enumClasses.name: Property
enumClasses.comment: Enumerated properties that can be used to run queries on the Message object

fields.name: ID
fields.comment: Message unique ID, not sortable and supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: POSITION
fields.comment: Message index, sortable and supports comparison by Equality, Inclusion or Relation

fields.name: CONVERSATION
fields.comment: Conversation that the message belongs to, not sortable and supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: IS_SENT
fields.comment: Whether the message was sent or not, sortable and supports comparisons by Equality

fields.name: SENT_AT
fields.comment: Sent at date for the message (epoch time in milliseconds), sortable and supports comparisons by Equality, Inclusion or Relation

fields.name: RECEIVED_AT
fields.comment: Received at date for the message (epoch time in milliseconds), sortable and supports comparisons by Equality, Inclusion or Relation

fields.name: SENT_BY_USER_ID
fields.comment: User ID of the sender, not sortable and supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: IS_UNREAD
fields.comment: Whether the message was unread or read, sortable and supports comparisons by Equality

fields.name: PART_MIME_TYPE
fields.comment: Mime type of the message parts that comprise this Message, not sortable and supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: PART_SIZE
fields.comment: Size of the Message parts, not sortable and supports comparison by Equality, Inclusion or Relation

fields.name: PART_IS_TRANSFER_PENDING
fields.comment: Whether the message part's transfer is pending or not, supports comparisons by Equality

fields.name: PART_IS_TRANSFERRING
fields.comment: Whether the message part's transfer is ongoing or not, supports comparisons by Equality

fields.name: PART_ANY_TRANSFERS_COMPLETE
fields.comment: Whether any of the message part transfer is complete, supports comparisons by Equality

fields.name: PART_ALL_TRANSFERS_COMPLETE
fields.comment: Whether all the message parts transfer is complete, supports comparisons by Equality

implementedInterfaces.name: Queryable
implementedInterfaces.comment:
Objects with Query support declare so on a per attribute basis by implementing this `Queryable`
interface.  Not all operators are available for each `Queryable` attribute. Consult the
documentation on each property for details about querying semantics.

instance.name: addParticipants
instance.comment:
Adds participants to this Conversation.  Participants are user IDs from an external
server, for example the identity server used to generate `identity tokens`.

The addition of a participant can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on a conversation's "participants" attribute.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: the list of participants to add.

instance.name: removeParticipants
instance.comment:
Removes participants from an existing Conversation. Participants are user IDs from an
external server, for example the identity server used to generate `identity tokens`.

The participant removal can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on a conversation's "participants" attribute.

parameters.name: participants
parameters.description: the list of participants to remove.

instance.name: delete
instance.comment:
Deletes a Conversation and all associated messages according to the given DeletionMode.  Any
in-memory representations will return `true` for their isDeleted() method.

The deletion can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and listening for
DELETE events.

parameters.name: deletionMode
parameters.description: the deletion mode to apply.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract void putMetadataAtKeyPath(java.lang.String keyPath, java.lang.String value)
instance.name: putMetadataAtKeyPath
instance.comment:
Puts the given value in the Conversation's metadata at the given key path.  If a value
already exists, it is overwritten with the new value.

parameters.name: keyPath
parameters.description: key path to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value to put at the given key path.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract void putMetadata(java.util.Map metadata, boolean isMerge)
instance.name: putMetadata
instance.comment:
Puts the given metadata map into the Conversation's metadata, either merging the provided
metadata map with the existing metadata, or replacing (if `isMerge` is false).  When merging,
a `null` value removes any existing value for that key path.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: metadata map to apply or merge.

parameters.name: isMerge
parameters.description: merge if true, replace if false.

instance.name: removeMetadataAtKeyPath
instance.comment: Removes the given key path from the Conversation's metadata.

parameters.name: keyPath
parameters.description: key path to remove from this Conversation's metadata.

instance.name: send
instance.comment:
Sends a Message to its Conversation, synchronizing the Message among all participants in the
Conversation, as well as all other devices the authenticated user logs in on. Sending a
message queues the message for synchronization with the Layer Cloud.  Message.isSent() allows
monitoring of this message's synchronization status.

The `isSent` transitions can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on the "isSent" attribute.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: the Message to send.

instance.name: send
instance.comment:
Sends a typing indication from the authenticated user to all participants in the given
Conversation.

parameters.name: indicator
parameters.description: TypingIndicator to send.

instance.declarationSignature: public abstract void send(com.layer.sdk.messaging.Message message, com.layer.sdk.listeners.LayerProgressListener listener)
instance.name: send
instance.comment:
Sends a Message to its Conversation, synchronizing the Message among all participants in the
Conversation, as well as all other devices the authenticated user logs in on. Sending a
message queues the message for synchronization with the Layer Cloud.  Message.isSent() allows
monitoring of this message's synchronization status.

The `isSent` transitions can be monitored by registering a LayerChangeEventListener and
listening for UPDATE events on the "isSent" attribute.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: the Message to send.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: upload progress notifications for individual message parts

instance.name: getId
instance.comment: A unique identifier for this Conversation.

returns.description: a unique identifier for this Conversation.

instance.name: getParticipants
instance.comment:
Returns the set of user identifiers specifying who is participating in the conversation
modeled by the receiver.  Layer conversations are addressed using user identifiers of the
host application.

LayerChangeEventListeners can capture participant addition and removal from a conversation
by listening for update events on the "participants" attribute.

instance.name: getLastMessage
instance.comment: The last message in this Conversation.

returns.description: the last message in this Conversation.

instance.name: isDeleted
instance.comment:
A conversation is considered `deleted` after LayerClient.deleteConversation() has been called
on it.  This will only appear on in-memory instances of a Conversation after it has been
deleted, either locally or remotely.  An attempt to load the conversation by ID will result
in `null` because it no longer exists. A registered LayerChangeEventListener can capture
the transition to isDeleted by monitoring for updates on the "isDeleted" attribute.  The
deletion of the conversation also results in a DELETE event.

returns.description: true if the Conversation is deleted; false otherwise.

instance.name: getMetadata
instance.comment: Returns the metadata associated with this Conversation.

returns.description: the metadata associated with this Conversation

classes.name: Conversation
classes.comment:
The `Conversation` class models a conversations between two or more participants within Layer. A
conversation is an on-going stream of messages (modeled by the `Message` class) synchronized
among all participants.

instance.name: isSortable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is sortable or not

returns.description: true when the Property is sortable, false otherwise

instance.name: isEqualityQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by equality or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by equality or not

instance.name: isRelativeQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by relation or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by relation or not

instance.name: isInclusionQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by inclusion or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by inclusion or not

fields.name: ID
fields.comment: Conversation unique ID, not sortable and supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: PARTICIPANTS
fields.comment: Conversation participants, sortable and supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: CREATED_AT
fields.comment: Timestamp of Conversation creation (epoch time in milliseconds), sortable and supports comparison by Equality, Inclusion or Relation

fields.name: LAST_MESSAGE
fields.comment: Last message received on the Conversation, sortable and supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: HAS_UNREAD_MESSAGES
fields.comment: Whether the Conversation has unread messages or not, sortable and supports comparison by Equality

fields.name: LAST_MESSAGE_RECEIVED_AT
fields.comment: Timestamp of last message received on the Conversation (epoch time in milliseconds), sortable and supports comparison by Equality, Inclusion or Relation

instance.name: deliveryReceipts
instance.comment:
Enables and disables the automatic generation of delivery receipts for received Messages.
The SDK enables delivery receipts by default.  Disabling delivery receipts increases
performance, but disables delivery and read receipts.

returns.description: this `Options` object.

parameters.name: deliveryReceipts
parameters.description:
`true` to enable delivery receipt generation, or `false` to
                        disable delivery receipts.

instance.name: isDeliveryReceipts
instance.comment: Returns `true` if this Options has delivery receipts enabled, or `false` if disabled.

returns.description: `true` if this Options has delivery receipts enabled, or `false` if disabled.

classes.name: ConversationOptions
classes.comment:
Conversation.Options provides an optional set of options to apply to a Conversation at
instantiation time.

implementedInterfaces.name: Queryable
implementedInterfaces.comment:
Objects with Query support declare so on a per attribute basis by implementing this `Queryable`
interface.  Not all operators are available for each `Queryable` attribute. Consult the
documentation on each property for details about querying semantics.

instance.name: getId
instance.comment: A unique identifier for this MessagePart.

returns.description: a unique identifier for this MessagePart.

instance.name: getMessage
instance.comment: The parent Message object this MessagePart belongs to.

returns.description: the parent Message this MessagePart belongs to.

instance.name: getMimeType
instance.comment:
The MIME type of the content contained in the data portion of this MessagePart, set
by the Application when the MessagePart is created.

returns.description: the MIME type of the content contained in the data portion of this MessagePart.

instance.name: getData
instance.comment: The content of the MessagePart as a byte array

returns.description: a byte array of data representing the payload of this MessagePart.

instance.name: getDataStream
instance.comment: The content of this MessagePart as a stream

returns.description: a stream of the payload of this MessagePart
The size of the data in this message part in bytes
The Transfer Status for the data in this message part to see if the this

instance.name: download
instance.comment:
Trigger the download of the data for a particular message part. If invoked on a message with
data already locally available, it will be returned in the listener callback immediately.

parameters.name: listener
parameters.description: Invoked with progress and the results.

instance.name: isContentReady
instance.comment:
Check whether the content for this message part has been fully downloaded. If not
see {@link #download(com.layer.sdk.listeners.LayerProgressListener)}

returns.description: Whether the message has local content.

instance.name: deleteLocalContent
instance.comment:
Deletes the locally stored data to free up disk space. This does not delete the data on the
server side.  The content can be downloaded again later by calling {@link #download(com.layer.sdk.listeners.LayerProgressListener)}.
Data smaller than 2KB is never deleted locally.

classes.name: MessagePart
classes.comment:
The `MessagePart` class represents a piece of content embedded within a containing
Message. Each part has a specific MIME type identifying the type of content it contains.
Messages may contain an arbitrary number of parts with any MIME type that the application
wishes to support.

fields.name: AWAITING_UPLOAD
fields.comment:
Content is available locally but has not been uploaded.
This state is expected before the message is sent.

fields.name: UPLOADING
fields.comment:
Content is available locally and is in a state of uploading.
This state is expected when message is in the sending process.

fields.name: READY_FOR_DOWNLOAD
fields.comment:
Content is not available locally but it is ready for download.
This state is expected when message part didn't met the criteria to be auto-downloaded.
Use `downloadContent` to initiate a manual download process.

fields.name: DOWNLOADING
fields.comment:
Content is not yet available locally and is in a state of downloading.
This state is expected when message part downloaded was started manually or by
using the auto-download feature.

fields.name: COMPLETE
fields.comment:
Content is available locally and on the server.
This is the expected state when the (upload or download) transfer completes.

instance.name: isSortable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is sortable or not

returns.description: true when the Property is sortable, false otherwise

instance.name: isEqualityQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by equality or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by equality or not

instance.name: isRelativeQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by relation or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by relation or not

instance.name: isInclusionQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the Property is comparable by inclusion or not

returns.description: whether the Property is comparable by inclusion or not

fields.name: ID
fields.comment: Message part's unique ID, not sortable and supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: INDEX
fields.comment: Message part's index in the Message, sortable and supports comparison by Equality, Inclusion or Relation

fields.name: TRANSFER_STATUS
fields.comment: Transfer status, sortable and supports comparison by Equality, Inclusion or Relation

fields.name: MESSAGE
fields.comment: Parent Message that this part belongs to, supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: MIME_TYPE
fields.comment: Mime type of the message part, supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

fields.name: SIZE
fields.comment: Size of the message part, supports comparison by Equality or Inclusion

instance.name: getSentByUserID
instance.comment: Specifies the sender of the content that the policy applies to. If `nil`, the policy applies to all senders.

classes.name: Policy
classes.comment:
The `Policy` object defines a policy that governs how communications destined for a given target user
will be routed within Layer.
It is important that you configure your `Policy` object appropriately before adding it
to a client. Layer client objects make a copy of the policy you provide and use the copy for evaluation
and enforcement. The policy objects maintained by the client are immutable and cannot be reconfigured.
If you need to modify a policy, then you must make a copy of it, apply the appropriate changes, add the
updated policy object to the client and remove the original policy (if appropriate).

enumClasses.name: PolicyType
enumClasses.comment: The `PolicyType` enumeration defines the types of policies that can be defined to govern communications within Layer.

fields.name: BLOCK
fields.comment: Defines a policy which will block a matching entity from communicating with the target.

instance.name: execute
instance.comment: Executes the underlying Query and performs a full UI refresh via onQueryDataSetChanged.

instance.name: getItemCount
instance.comment: Returns the current item count.

returns.description: the current item count.

instance.name: getItem
instance.comment: Returns the Queryable item at the given position.

instance.name: getPosition
instance.comment:
Returns the position of the given Queryable within the RecyclerViewController's collection,
or -1 if it is not contained.

returns.description:
The position of the Queryable within this controller's collection, or -1 if it is
not in the collection.

parameters.name: queryable
parameters.description: The Queryable item to find the position of.

classes.name: RecyclerViewController
classes.comment:
RecyclerViewController can be used to drive a RecyclerView.Adapter from a Query.  This controller
attaches itself to a LayerClient and automatically generates callbacks for notifying a
RecyclerView.Adapter about UI updates.

instance.name: onQueryDataSetChanged
instance.comment: Alerts the observer that the underlying dataset totally changed and should be rebound.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: the RecyclerViewController which generated this callback.

instance.name: onQueryItemChanged
instance.comment: Alerts the observer that the content of a given item changed.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: the RecyclerViewController which generated this callback.

instance.declarationSignature: public void onQueryItemRangeChanged(com.layer.sdk.query.RecyclerViewController controller, int positionStart, int itemCount)
instance.name: onQueryItemRangeChanged
instance.comment: Alerts the observer that the content of a range of items changed.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: the RecyclerViewController which generated this callback.

instance.name: onQueryItemInserted
instance.comment: Alerts the observer that an item was inserted.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: the RecyclerViewController which generated this callback.

instance.declarationSignature: public void onQueryItemRangeInserted(com.layer.sdk.query.RecyclerViewController controller, int positionStart, int itemCount)
instance.name: onQueryItemRangeInserted
instance.comment: Alerts the observer that a range of items was inserted.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: the RecyclerViewController which generated this callback.

instance.name: onQueryItemRemoved
instance.comment: Alerts the observer that an item was removed.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: the RecyclerViewController which generated this callback.

instance.declarationSignature: public void onQueryItemRangeRemoved(com.layer.sdk.query.RecyclerViewController controller, int positionStart, int itemCount)
instance.name: onQueryItemRangeRemoved
instance.comment: Alerts the observer that a range of items was removed.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: the RecyclerViewController which generated this callback.

instance.declarationSignature: public void onQueryItemMoved(com.layer.sdk.query.RecyclerViewController controller, int fromPosition, int toPosition)
instance.name: onQueryItemMoved
instance.comment: Alerts the observer that an item moved.

parameters.name: controller
parameters.description: the RecyclerViewController which generated this callback.

nestedClasses.name: Callback
nestedClasses.comment: The RecyclerViewController.Callback is designed to drive a RecyclerView.Adapter.

constructor.name: CompoundPredicate
constructor.comment: Creates and returns a new compound predicate with the given type and subpredicates in a given array.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Compound predicate type for the logical relation between sub-predicates

parameters.name: subPredicates
parameters.description: A list of `Predicate` instances that compose this `CompoundPredicate`.

instance.name: getType
instance.comment: Retrieves the type for the logical relation between sub-predicates

returns.description: type for the logical relation between sub-predicates

instance.name: getSubPredicates
instance.comment: Retrieves the list of `Predicate` objects that comprise this `CompoundPredicate`

returns.description: list of `Predicate` objects that comprise this `CompoundPredicate`

classes.name: CompoundPredicate
classes.comment:
The `CompoundPredicate` class is a subclass of `Predicate` that provides support for combining
multiple sub-predicates into a grouping with a conjunction operator such as
`And`, `Or`, or `Not`.

enumClasses.name: Type
enumClasses.comment:
The `Type` enumeration defines the set of comparison operators available for use by
`Predicate` objects.

instance.name: getId
instance.comment: Retrieves the unique id of this `Queryable` object

returns.description: the unique id of this `Queryable` object

classes.name: Queryable
classes.comment:
Objects with Query support declare so on a per attribute basis by implementing this `Queryable`
interface.  Not all operators are available for each `Queryable` attribute. Consult the
documentation on each property for details about querying semantics.

instance.name: isSortable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the results of the query are sortable or not

returns.description: true if the query results are sortable, false otherwise

instance.name: isEqualityQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the query compares objects by equality

returns.description: true if the query compares by equality, false otherwise

instance.name: isRelativeQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the query compares objects by relation between objects

returns.description: true if the query compares by relation between objects, false otherwise

instance.name: isInclusionQueryable
instance.comment: Retrieves whether the query compares objects by inclusion in a set

returns.description: true if the query compares by inclusion, false otherwise

derivedClasses.name: Property
derivedClasses.comment: Enumerated properties that can be used to run queries on the Message object

derivedClasses.name: MessagePart
derivedClasses.comment:
The `MessagePart` class represents a piece of content embedded within a containing
Message. Each part has a specific MIME type identifying the type of content it contains.
Messages may contain an arbitrary number of parts with any MIME type that the application
wishes to support.

derivedClasses.name: Message
derivedClasses.comment:
The `Message` class represents a message within a conversation (modeled by the `Conversation`
class) between two or more participants within Layer.

derivedClasses.name: Conversation
derivedClasses.comment:
The `Conversation` class models a conversations between two or more participants within Layer. A
conversation is an on-going stream of messages (modeled by the `Message` class) synchronized
among all participants.

constructor.name: SortDescriptor
constructor.comment: Creates a sort descriptor based on the property to sort and the sort `Order`

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: based on which we should sort the results

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: of the sort results

instance.name: getProperty
instance.comment: The Property that is being sorted

returns.description: The Property that is being sorted

instance.name: getOrder
instance.comment: The order the sorted results should be returned in

returns.description: The order the sorted results should be returned in

classes.name: SortDescriptor
classes.comment:
Configures the sort descriptors used to order the result set. The sort descriptors specify how
the objects returned when the query is executed should be ordered (for example by creation date
or index). The sort descriptors are applied in the order in which they are added to a Query.  A
value of null (the default) means that no explicit sorting is applied and the results are
returned in an unspecified order.

constructor.declarationSignature: public Predicate(com.layer.sdk.query.Queryable.Property property, com.layer.sdk.query.Predicate.Operator operator, java.lang.Object value)
constructor.name: Predicate
constructor.comment: Creates a `Predicate` with the given property, operator, and value.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: The property whose value is to be compared.

parameters.name: operator
parameters.description: The operator that determines how the property's value is compared to the reference value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The reference value to use in the comparison.

instance.name: getProperty
instance.comment: Retrieves the property whose value the receiver will compare against the reference value.

returns.description: the property whose value the receiver will compare against the reference value

instance.name: getOperator
instance.comment:
Retrieves the predicate operator that specifies how the property's value will be compared
against the reference value.

returns.description: the predicate operator that specifies how the property's value will be compared

instance.name: getValue
instance.comment: Retrieves the the reference object used for comparison

returns.description: the reference object used for comparison

instance.name: isRelative
instance.comment: Checks whether the operator type of the `Predicate` is Relative

returns.description: returns true if the `Operator` of this `Predicate` is Relative

instance.name: isEquality
instance.comment: Checks whether the operator type of the `Predicate` is comparing for Equality

returns.description: returns true if the `Operator` of this `Predicate` is comparing for Equality

instance.name: isInclusion
instance.comment: Checks whether the operator type of the `Predicate` is comparing for Inclusion

returns.description: returns true if the `Operator` of this `Predicate` is comparing for Inclusion

classes.name: Predicate
classes.comment:
The `Predicate` class is used to describe a comparison between the value of a specified property and an input
value using a comparison operator.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: the type of operator

instance.name: getType
instance.comment: Reetreives the `Type` of operator

returns.description: the type of the operator

enumClasses.name: Operator
enumClasses.comment: The `Operator` enumeration defines the set of comparison operators available for use by `Predicate` objects.

fields.name: EQUAL_TO
fields.comment: The property's value is equal to the given value.

fields.name: NOT_EQUAL_TO
fields.comment: The property's value is not equal to the given value.

fields.name: LESS_THAN
fields.comment: The property's value is less than the given value.

fields.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
fields.comment: The property's value is less than or equal to the given value.

fields.name: GREATER_THAN
fields.comment: The property's value is greater than the given value.

fields.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
fields.comment: The property's value is greater than or equal to the given value.

fields.name: IN
fields.comment: The property's value is contained in the given collection of values.

fields.name: NOT_IN
fields.comment: The property's value is not contained in the given collection of values.

derivedClasses.name: CompoundPredicate
derivedClasses.comment:
The `CompoundPredicate` class is a subclass of `Predicate` that provides support for combining
multiple sub-predicates into a grouping with a conjunction operator such as
`And`, `Or`, or `Not`.

static.name: builder
static.comment:
A convenience Builder object that can be used to build queries by providing the `Queryable`
class and adding fields such as `Predicate`, limit, offset and `SortDescriptor` as needed

instance.name: getPredicate
instance.comment: The predicate of the Query.

returns.description: The predicate of the Query.

instance.name: getLimit
instance.comment:
The limit configures the maximum number of objects to be returned when the query is executed.
A value of `Long.MAX_VALUE` (the default) indicates that no limit should be applied.

returns.description: The maximum number of results to be returned.

instance.name: getOffset
instance.comment:
The offset configures the number of rows that are to be skipped in the result set before
results are returned. The default value is zero. The `offset` isn't used if the `limit` is
not defined.

returns.description: The number of rows that are skipped in the result set.

instance.name: getSortDescriptors
instance.comment:
Gets the sort descriptors used to order the result set.
The sort descriptors specify how the objects returned when the query is executed should be
ordered (for example by creation date or index). The sort descriptors are
applied in the order in which they appear in the `sortDescriptors` array. A value of nil (the
default) means that no explicit sorting is applied and the results are returned in database
row order.

returns.description: List of `SortDescriptors` used to order the result set of the `Query`

instance.name: getQueryClass
instance.comment: Gets the class that this query is constructed to run on.

returns.description: The class that this query is constructed to run on.

classes.name: Query
classes.comment:
The `Query` class provides a flexible querying interface for Layer content.

Instances of `Query` are used to query the local database for messaging content. Queries target a specific queryable class
and apply a predicate that constrains the search. Predicates are expressed in terms of a public property (such as `createdAt` or `isUnread`), an operator
(such as 'is equal to' or 'is greater than or equal to'), and a comparison value. The sort order of the results can be affected by applying one or more
sort descriptors which also bind to a public property and are applied in either ascending or descending order. To facilitate pagination, queries may be further
constrained by applying a limit and offset value. Query results can be returned as either fully realized object instances, object identifiers, or as an aggregate
count of the total number of objects matching the query.

instance.name: predicate
instance.comment: Adds a predicate to the query

returns.description: Builder of the query that the predicate is being applied on

parameters.name: predicate
parameters.description: predicate that will be applied for the query

instance.name: limit
instance.comment: Adds a limit to the query.

returns.description: Builder of the query that the limit is being applied on

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The that will be applied for the query. The limit configures the maximum
             number of objects to be returned when the query is executed.

instance.name: offset
instance.comment: Adds an offset to the query

returns.description: Builder of the query that the offset is being applied on

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
Configures the number of rows that are to be skipped in the result set
              before results are returned. The default value is zero. The `offset` isn't
              used if the `limit` is not defined.

instance.name: sortDescriptor
instance.comment: Adds an offset to the query

returns.description: Builder of the query that the sort descriptors are being applied on.

parameters.name: sortDescriptors
parameters.description: List of descriptors that specify order of the result set.

instance.name: build
instance.comment: Builds and returns the resultant query based on the parameters provided to the `Builder`

returns.description: The resultant `Query` based on the parameters provided to the `Builder`

enumClasses.name: ResultType
enumClasses.comment: Specifies the type of result produced by the execution of a query.

fields.name: OBJECTS
fields.comment: The query is to return fully realized object instances.

fields.name: IDENTIFIERS
fields.comment: The query is to return object identifier Uri objects.

fields.name: COUNT
fields.comment: The query is to return a count of the number of results matching the executed query.
